data.text:
My room was really big and clean, with a comfortable bed that was changed every other day.

The hotel is in a great location, just across the road to a mainline train station and tube.

It’s a great place to be based, with the sea just a 15 minute walk, and lots of historic sites.

I’ve rarely walked as much in a break; including up a nearby mountain (well - big hill I suppose) where there was an old castle on the top. See pics.

The staff were great! Other than the catering staff they all spoke English and all of the staff were very friendly.

In case you’ve seen me review this hotel twice it’s not dodgy; I just can’t find my original review.

The breakfast was served on the top floor and the area is surrounded by huge windows giving an amazing view. There’s a large area outside so you can have a cigarette break up there enjoying the views.

The jewel of this hotel was the spa. They have a plunge pool, showers, sauna and a great massage team. I was treated by a beautiful blue eyed lady, who, after one of my really long walks, managed to get all of the knots out of my tired muscles. I’ll be in Izmir again in June and will definitely spend some time in there again.

I need to address some criticisms I’ve seen in the reviews. I honestly wonder if they were writing by competing hotels..

My room was perfectly clean. It was spacious. The bathroom was perfect. Everything worked. I really don’t know how anyone would criticise the staff or the room.

If there’s one downside it was being so close to the speakers for the nearby mosque. The call to prayer was very very loud and woke me every single morning. Other than that the noise was ok, even though it was in a main road and across from the station.
data.title: Great hotel in a central location

data.text:
The room decor is very dated and the two bedroom lights did not work and when I examined them further there were just bare wires inside the shade 
The bathroom sink was cracked 
On the balcony the guard rail was loose and dangerous to lean on 
The drawers in the cupboards couldn’t be used as you couldn’t open them because they were too stiff 
Breakfast consisted of the usual Turkish fare olives,eggs,some tomato and onion concoction which didn’t taste too bad better than it looked 
Sliced bread served out of a carrier bag and tea or Nescafé coffee I only had breakfast twice the first day for a coffee because for some reason they didn’t offer it as a room extra plenty of tea and sugar but no coffee 
I ended up buying the 3in 1 Nescafé from a local supermarket as I said I used the breakfast service twice once for coffee and the second time I tried a bit of everything on offer I wasn’t impressed so didn’t bother again 
There is also a rule in the hotel that you cannot take food to your room and bags will be searched and any food confiscated and will only be given back on the day you leave 
The only saving grace for the hotel was the cleaners who came every day to change towels etc and is one of the reasons the review got two stars 
If you are offered room 206 give it a miss it might be cheap but it isn’t worth it 
Also being right opposite the main road their is a lot of traffic noise all day and night and the mosque opposite also also has calls to prayer several times a day and the noise from the loudspeakers makes it feel as if it’s in the room 
My impression is it needs a total makeover new decor etc to make it presentable and I do know it’s a Muslim country but like any other in the world it should be offering international fare on its breakfast menu even if it included toast it would be a positive move as long as they include butter which was something else that was missing from the breakfast fare
data.title: Not bad but also not very good

data.text:
i was for 2 days at grand corner. the location is very good. just in frint if Basmane station where you can take metro or train. and it is about 15 mn to reach the port.
the room is quite big. and even it is on the main road but not noisy.
the guys at the reception:
Ramiz and Sadullah were very gentle and kind and helpfull. but Mezhut had a bad behavior with us. we asked him why they didnt clean the room, he said you didnt ask. we asked for some help he was very bad with us even he was speaking our same language.
besides that, the breakfast was served in a close restaurant because they were doing reforms in their own restaurant. so it was very poor and not well served.
besides that, it could be a good choice the hotel.
data.title: good

data.text:
The rooms are big enough, clean, and well equipped. The people at the front desk are very helpful, friendly, and honest (they found one of our students' purse with the money inside and gave it back promptly). 
It's near the Bazar, the train station, and the metro station, in an area with plenty of restaurants.
Breakfast is basic though, and it's a bit noisy because it's in the main street.
data.title: Good value for the money

data.text:
Was slightly concerned following a few bad reviews. The decor is dated and bedroom carpets need cleaning.
But I found the staff friendly, the rooms clean, the bed was incredibly comfortable and breakfast was lovely and varied. I would stay again.
data.title: What was expected
